website_summaries.verdict: An excellent midrange dSLR, the Canon EOS 7D delivers for the money.
cons: some annoying small and hard-to-feel buttons
limited to three shots for bracketing

website_summaries.verdict: The Canon EOS 7D is one of the best midrange D-SLRs money can buy. But if you don't need comprehensive video recording features or ultra-high-resolution images, there are a handful of competing D-SLRs that produce comparable image quality for half the price.
cons: Video recording is not as simple as with a dedicated camcorder

customer_reviews.title: Canon 7d for Novices and Pros alike.
customer_reviews.text: The Canon 7d is a top of the line camera that has been on the market a long time. Packaged in a variety of configurations through the years, always providing the novice or expert with exceptional performance and ease of use. I purchased this Canon 7d (body only) after having owned one for many years and giving it as a gift, with a complete assortment of accessories to my granddaughter who has demonstrated a unique eye for capturing and framing pictures. The availability is very limited as the manufacturer has discontinued the model replacing it with the Canon 7d Mark II.
customer_reviews.author: Roland Mata

customer_reviews.title: Solid Camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. Focuses quickly and good metering. Not the quietest, but not important to me. I dropped this in some dirty canyon water with a 16-35L lense. Immediately pulled it out of the water, took the battery out, dried it off, and placed it in water for two weeks. Worst two weeks of my life, but the camera still worked!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sterling Howells

customer_reviews.title: A top of the line option
customer_reviews.text: I am a working sports photographer and have two of these camera bodies. They are sturdy work horses with all of the specialized features that I need to capture great photos. It does everything I need for it to do and stands up to long days. My first 7D is still going strong with hundreds of thousainds of pics taken - a lot of high speed sports. Sure, I could go with a more costly model, but I have put my money in my lenses and my work stacks up to those using the 5s.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen R

customer_reviews.title: Wow! What a camera!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Canon 7D. This is my second one. I have been using one along with my original 20d for a few years now with my pro glass. I got tired of deciding which lens to put in the 20d before each shoot. Buying the second 7d resolved that. I can't say enough about the quality and features of this camera. My advice if you are new to Canon pro and semi pro cameras is to read the manual, take a class or both. I'm always finding new features that I was unaware of.
customer_reviews.author: Hiknva

customer_reviews.title: Awesome piece of equipment!
customer_reviews.text: This camera blows away my canon 40d. I used it with a 24-70mm L and Speedlite external flash on a very dark night club. I could not see through the viewfinder but the pictures came out awesome. The auto white balance is superior to the 40d under any condition. For video, use prime lenses and L glass only. Shoot on manual. do not use Auto or P. Depending on the light you might end up with orange, dark or grainy footage. highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: m

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this body used and was a little anxious as to what I was going to get and there were a few hundred dollars involved. I held my breath and have been more than pleased with the quality of this preowned camera body. And most importantly, thrilled with the 7d - all the reviews were correct - it's a tank (don't even think of getting this camera if weight is a consideration) that takes great pix. I wanted a cropped sensor body to go with my 5DM2 so I could use and buy cheaper lenses. More full frame $1,000+ lenses are out of my league and the 7d has been a welcome addition.
customer_reviews.author: EssGee

customer_reviews.title: Camera and Service First Class
customer_reviews.text: This camera is perfect and the service from Photo4Less was equal to this excellent piece of photo equipment. I expected the camera to be top of the line as far as controls, ergonomics and results, but Photo4Less exceeded my expectations. Their service is world class. It was supposed come in two days, but came next day delivery. The camera is easy to use and if set on program mode gives a photographer all the control needed to take great pictures. It feels perfect no matter what lens I have on it from ultra wide to super telephoto. I have no complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: Larry S. Singer

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera and amazing camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great intermediate camera. It has a lot of features of professional quality cameras but at a great price. The only thing I would change on this would be to make it a full frame camera instead of a crop sensor, but that would increase the price. I am still thrilled with this camera a year and a half after I upgraded from a rebel and love all the features that are packed into this camera. It is pricier than the rebel series or other introductory DSLRs, but this a a great stepping point when expanding into the world of high quality DSLRs.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander E Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this the 7D to replace my T2i. I also have a 5D M2 and the 7D complements the 5D much better. Same Battery, same remote trigger, etc. 7D has a more advanced focusing system, but I use spot focus mostly on both cameras. Internal level is nice. I use all Red ring lenses and the quality of photographs I get with the 7D are excellent. I don't push the ISO much above 400 and I haven't had any noise issues that some others have mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Jack F.

customer_reviews.title: Canon 7D 18mp CMOS SLR Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is being used by the big boys in Hollywood as "B" roll cameras. Several of the popular TV shows are using it alongside the Canon 5D because the sensor size gives the cinematographers a better choice of "depth of view" possiblities. I am retired from motion pictures and am amazed at how wonderful these cameras perform at such a low price. No more brute cameras to carry. Wonderful for mobility and quickness. Highly recommend to anyone who wants the best of both worlds.
customer_reviews.author: W. Gravning

customer_reviews.title: The 8 frames per second is amazing too.
customer_reviews.text: I shoot a LOT of sports in low light conditions. With this camera I can push the ISO to 3200 without worrying about how noisy or grainy the photos will be. The 8 frames per second is amazing too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Canon 7d Body Used Very Good With 1 Year guarantee Terrific Buy
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase; looks and feels as new. No scuff marks or dings. Refurbished by Canon technicians and comes with a i year warranty from Canon on parts and labor.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: This camera is near perfect. The weight
customer_reviews.text: This camera is near perfect. The weight, build, picture quality.. all of it I am in love. When I first started using it I was a bit disappointed with the noise level in the photos but with some proper tweaking of the settings it has gotten to be minimal and then I use the Noiseware plug in for Photoshop in post processing. Honestly, it could be a bit better in low light conditions but outside of that it's an excellent camera.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: A great camera
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the camera for about 4 weeks now, which is about what it will take o get used to most of the bells and whistles. It is a wonderful camera. It won't take the pictures for you (OK, maybe it will), but it does give you the power to take some incredibly good photos under a wide variety of circumstances. It is solidly made, and has the weight to prove it. Despite its enormous capabilities and options, it is relatively easy to learn to use, and the controls are well laid out. Battery life is surprisingly good. The color of the photos is fantastic. Color me pleased with the camera at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Rosenthal

customer_reviews.title: Canon EOS 7D Camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera and the fact that it is a Canon product makes it even better. Took me just a while to adjust to using it but now that I have I have to admit I like it as well as the Canon 5D Mark III we bought too. Use the L lenses and you cannot beat the beautiful images you will have. We have many compliments on our pictures. My fiance' prefers the full frame but I like the other just as well.
customer_reviews.author: YorkieMom315

customer_reviews.title: Excellent condition
customer_reviews.text: Excellent condition, but it didn't come on a leash. I had to buy it separately. In the description it appeared.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for professional use in film and photography.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first camera and I bought it to use mostly for shooting films but also photography. I've only had this for a little over a year. I've done work with different celebrities, models, music artists & bands, fashion shows, etc. If you want professional work and have the money GET THIS CAMERA. I promise you won't be dissatisfied. For a more in depth review of this camera check out my YouTube review. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I am professional photographer and I used this camera for 5 years. Now its my back up. For the age of the camera its an absolute beast! You will love it!
customer_reviews.author: JW tucson

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed using this camera for as long as it lasted. I got it refurbished I believe and it stopped working about 2 weeks later. The err 40 came up and has not worked since. Other than that, I really like how easy it was to use. It was a tad bit heavy, but it felt really good in the hands. (Still waiting for a solution).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love my 7D
customer_reviews.text: The 7D is easy to use (if you know your way around SLRs) and the photos it takes are gorgeous - even in low light. I debated going with the 5D, but I'm glad I saved the money because the image quality meets my needs and the built-in flash has come in handy several times. The only thing that hasn't been easy to figure out is the video function. It isn't at all like shooting video with a point-and-shoot, and focusing is a problem because it's a difficult to tell if the focus is spot-on using the small display on the back, and once you start recording the auto focus stops working.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stanaland

customer_reviews.title: This camera is fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I recommend just getting the body and forking out for a better lens, like the 24-105 L lens. Nothing really to say that hasn't been said, but I wanted to add my 5 stars. I love that Canon can product a product much more timeless than Apple. The 7d isn't new, and I wouldn't even go after a new edition when it comes out next year (rumored).
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Hotchkiss

customer_reviews.title: Excelente shoice.
customer_reviews.text: I have the Canon T3i and switched to the 7D. Its autofocus is higher, the current 7D (19-point auto focus), the construction is a fundamental point, is practically armored, but has never fallen me I want it to fall. The high speed for action shots is excellent. Despite not being full frame censor chose me instead of the Canon 6D. When you switch to full frame conservare this camera as a second body as I have with my current T3i. Definitely an excellent camera 7D Semi-Pro.
customer_reviews.author: José Sutherland

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with the camera and the condition I received it was excellent like new with no marks or blemishes. All features and functions operate very well. I'm very satisfied with the landscape image results I have received.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I am Nikon user but have had some Canon as well. This replaced my d300 that I sold (which shouldn't have) and it turned out all well. Fast focusing and FPS. Love the full size body and sound of its shutter. The sensor is average like all canons suffering from low DR but I own Nikon for that. I prefer this one by a wide margin over 70D. Recommended

Nice seller. Nice Cam. i wanted to order a second one but its no longer in stock. can i cry now?

My son bought one and uses it for his professional video work in NYC shooting HD for the likes of Disney (his rig is extensive). Price/performance both my wife & son paid for their rigs in months.

customer_reviews.title: I've taken many pictures in outdoor sports with very good quality, my clients are very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I already have three years with this camera and it works very well, I've taken many pictures in outdoor sports with very good quality, my clients are very satisfied. I recommend it, as well as its successor, the Canon 7D mark II.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Julio Marval Romero

customer_reviews.title: What can I say?
customer_reviews.text: That hasn't been said already about this camera! Love it. I'm a canon fan and took about 3 months deciding to buy it, and glad I did. I won't go into detail because everyone else has said so much, just saying it's probably the best Camera around for this money. Took it to Gettysburg civil war cemetary and the pictures are stunning. I used the Rebel series for about a year and stepped up to this. You'll be very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Mccarrell

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, not-so-great battery life.
customer_reviews.text: The camera is great and works as intended, but the battery life wasn't all that good. It could be because I bought it used, but I still love this camera regardless!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Jones

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: Had all it said it would, cosmetically looks great! Excellent quality! Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Connor Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: she's a bad*ss
customer_reviews.text: it was time for me to start filming and this is the most practical tool for what im doing. ive been shooting stills on the 5d for the last 6 years, its a beautiful, user friendly camera, but after so, so many clicks she's ready to be moved to back up. the 7d is missing the full frame censor, big whoop- id challenge the individual who could spot a difference in my photographs. this is light and versatile and im entirely satisfied with everything thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Waniewski

customer_reviews.title: Great Wedding photos
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great for the beginner (in auto) or professional and with 18mp you get enough data to zoom in on photos and still be able to make 8x10 copies. If you have big hands or like a full grip you will need the camera grip that is available. I've shot several weddings with this camera and am very pleased with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Danny H. Newport

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great camera if you're on a budget and need a semi-pro camera to shoot with.
customer_reviews.author: David E.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy photojournalist workhorse for a good price
customer_reviews.text: As a photojournalist and wedding photographer I need a durable camera and this is it. I've been hard on it with daily use and I haven't had any problems. I love the high FPS. My biggest complaints is that the colors don't seem as vibrant as they could be and this gets worse at higher ISOs.
customer_reviews.author: C. P.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE EOS 7D
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent camera. This is sami-pro camera but you will get more bang for your buck! 7D is out for a long time and going strong. Just like 5D series this camera is solid and performs amazingly. With 18 mpx, 1080p HD video recording, with 8 fps fast shooting, this one has everything you need and want in a camera. I have used this camera before and fall in love with it... So my wife bought for me as my Christmas Gift... Thank you, Cheers!!!

customer_reviews.title: great camera

customer_reviews.title: :D!!

customer_reviews.title: Favorite camera
customer_reviews.text: This is probably my favorite camera I own, and its not even the newest or nicest one. I have had problems with non canon parts working with it though. I like the fact that it is very well made and durable. Has taken a beating and still works well.
customer_reviews.author: The Awesome!

customer_reviews.title: I am in LOVE with my camera
customer_reviews.text: I am in LOVE with my camera! It was used but still in great condition and it has been so fun to take pictures with it. I'm still learning all of its functions but its very easy to use and takes wonderful pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Keeley

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is a good camera. I purchased it to upgrade from my rebel. It didn't do wonders in a low-light reception I was shooting, but that very well could have been user error. So far I've really enjoyed it, though.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: The best crop-DSLR out there!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! The all new focusing system works like a charm, and you have the built in wireless flash functions. All the good and bad things about this camera has already been mentioned; although I will say that coming from a Rebel XSi, it takes quite a bit of time to get use to the focusing/metering system. 7D is a much larger camera than the XSi, so you might want to invest in a good camera backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Wide Awakes

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I moved away from DSLRs for awhile because of the poor performance in low lighting didn't meet my needs shooting concerts and at night. The price on the 7d finally went down enough I felt it was worth a try and am very glad I did. High ISO noise is minimal. The auto focus system is sharp (I'm using a 24-105 f/4L lens and 50mm f/1.8, both focus quickly and accurately) and adaptable to my needs. Everything this camera does it does it perfectly. There's nothing I'd change about this camera.
customer_reviews.author: JTW

customer_reviews.title: Got everything I wanted in a camera
customer_reviews.text: I started with Canon film SLR. The 7D was a replacement for my Rebel XSi. I needed better indoor pictures without flash. I like the higher and auto ISO, full and brighter view finder, easy to use Live View, and built in wireless flash control. Given all these features, I don't mind the bigger body. The only other thing thing that I wanted is to use the wireless flash without firing the camera's flash.
customer_reviews.author: S C

customer_reviews.title: Sweet baby
customer_reviews.text: just amazing camera to have as a backup when you are using a 5D MKII as a main body. besides, I have now the doublé of lenses since the cropped sensor of this baby makes longer distances of all my lenses used with full frame on 5D
customer_reviews.author: Joan L. Sansary M

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: It's such an easy to use camera. I love the live view option on it, especially because I do a lot of still life and have a crappy lens. With it, I can make sure the focus is right on. I had a Rebel XT before and this is definitely a HUGE upgrade. The images are clearer, the color is closer to what it should be, and there are way more options. It's a good price and works almost just as well as the 5D Mark III, almost. I haven't done much with the HD video, but I hear it's a great function.
customer_reviews.author: duckyleigh1

customer_reviews.author: CID Monteiro

customer_reviews.title: Most improved Canon of the last 5 years.
customer_reviews.text: Autofocus choices are various but yet accuracy has a way to go even when using center point autofocus. With my previous Canons, I had an 80% rate of autofocus failures for flying birds. With my 7D the autofocus failure rate has been reduced to about 60%. Image quality quite superior to that of the 40D and the 50D at ISO 400. The 8 frames speed is great. The menu is easy to use and allows for lots of choices, yet, no single push button for mirror lock-up and autofocus point selection now requires to push two buttons rather than one in the previous cameras. A smart choice for nature photography due to its 1.6X sensor, weight and size.
customer_reviews.author: Jose E. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Canon excellence

customer_reviews.title: EOS 7D Rocks
customer_reviews.text: I've been a professional Canon shooter for over thirty years. In this poor economy I decided to look at 'pro-sumer' level DSLR's. For the Wedding on the riverboat or the vows renewal in a hot air balloon, I have to say this camera really surprises. It's not a 1D but I did not pay 1D money so I feel that I can make this work. The key to quality, after skill, is good glass. Buy the best lens you can afford, and slap it on this baby, and you might find, like I did, that paying the highest price does not make you a pro. Composition and the eye are the ticket.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Pictures!
customer_reviews.text: My wife is the camera buff and is an avid hobbyist. Moving up from a Rebel wasn't just a step forward, it was a leap to the top with this Canon EOS 7D. My wife's action photos are sharper; with the camera speed and lenses she's capturing more feel with every shot. I am not the only one seeing/saying these things as our children's dance and sports team parents who view the shots on smug mug have equally exceptional positive comments. The photographer I bought this camera for was already the best: with the 7D her photography is even better.

product_meta.description: Style:Body Only| Configuration:US VersionDesigned for pros and semi-pros alike, the Canon EOS 7D Digital SLR Camera Body is a high-performance digital SLR, that features the resolving power of an 18-megapixel APS-C format CMOS sensor and dual DIGIC 4 image processors that enable 8 frames-per-second capture of high-definition, low-noise imaging at sensitivity levels up to ISO 12800. It accepts lenses with EF or EF-S mounts.In addition to high-definition still images the Canon EOS 7D can also capture true HD 1080p video at 30 frames per second. Video clips can be up to 12 minutes in length or 4GB in size, and you can make full use of all Canon EF and EF-S-mount lenses, which enables an exceptional range of creative visual possibilities. And to ensure clean, blemish-free image files, the 7D employs a dual dust-reduction system.The EOS 7Ds Intelligent Viewfinder enables 100% viewing of the total image area, and features a transparent LCD overlay option that enables advanced data display within the optical viewfinder including user-selected AF modes, a spot metering circle, and on-demand grid lines. In addition to the 7Ds optical viewfinder a Live View mode enables you to compose, review, and edit images using the cameras 3", 920,000-dot TFT LCD. The 7D also features a Dual Axis Electronic Level and tilt display that enables you to adjust the roll and pitch of the camera in 1° increments, using the viewfinder or LCD.For continuous shooting sequences, the 7D can capture bursts of up to 126 JPEGs (large) when using UDMA CF memory cards, or 15 when shooting RAW files. An enhanced all cross-type 19-point autofocus system enables extremely accurate AI Servo AF subject tracking and user-selectable AF modes for precise focusing.
